short_summary: The project involves the dredging of the Whitby Harbour Remediation Project and the provision of multi-disciplinary services.
description: \\\\nAMENDMENT TO CLOSING TIME: Please disregard the Ariba Discovery posting response deadline closing time and Buyandsell posting closing time. All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted on May 16, 2023 by 2:00 PM EDT. All bids submitted after 2:00 PM EDT will result in the bid being declared non-responsive. \\\\\nPublic Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) intends to retain a Civil/Environmental engineering consulting firm for the provision of the multi-disciplinary services. This project requires the Consultant firm to prepare the Detailed Engineering Design for the implementation of the Whitby Harbour Remediation Project in the Whitby Small Craft Harbour. \\\\nSediment remediation approach planned for the Site is: Hydraulic dredging with vacuum consolidation or other appropriate sediment de-watering method, followed by off-site disposal in a permitted landfill. \\\\nThe Consultant(s) shall provide a range of services as identified in the Required Services section of the Solicitation document. \\\\nThe Request for Proposal (RFP) is a single submission process.\\\\n
full_summary:
# Request For Proposal (RFP) for Engineering Design Services
## Title

### Project Title
Whitby Harbour Sediment Management Project

### Invitation Language
English | Français
Engineering Design Services | Services de conception technique

### Solicitation Reference
WS3764756028-Doc3949160375

### Tender Information

### Tender Closing Date
The tender closing date is May 16, 2023 at 2:00 PM EDT. Late bids will not be considered.

### Expected Contract Duration
The contract is expected to commence on May 31, 2023, and end on June 12, 2026.

### Description of Services

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) intends to retain a Civil/Environmental engineering consulting firm for the provision of multi-disciplinary services. The project requires the Consultant firm to prepare the Detailed Engineering Design for the implementation of the Whitby Harbour Remediation Project in the Whitby Small Craft Harbour. The proposed sediment remediation approach involves hydraulic dredging with vacuum consolidation or other suitable sediment de-watering method, followed by offsite disposal at an external permitted landfill.

### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation will be based on the Selection Criteria, which comprise a Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price.

### Trade Agreements

The contract is subject to various Trade Agreements, including the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), and others.

### Supporting Documents

A link to the solicitation document is available on Ariba Discovery.

No signatures or statements are required from Technical Writers in this project. However, your team is expected to **translate this documentation** with all the required details. Only a limited amount of editing is allowed for formatting, spelling, grammar and punctuation corrections.  You must also follow the Government of Canada's translation style guide. 

For the translated product, you need to send me a Markdown file containing the result. 

Each item should separate by two new lines. The converted text can have Markdown formatting, links, and line breaks among other features. When you submit, the Markdown file should have the following filename structure: 
```
